title: CHRIS SUTTON: Steve Bruce inspired a Rafa Benitez-esque performance out of Newcastle
text:
This was a disciplined, Rafa Benitez-esque display from Newcastle United at St James’ Park.

After their horrific 5-0 loss to Leicester last week, Steve Bruce opted for a back three, and it delivered him a clean sheet.

He showed faith in young Matty Longstaff in midfield, and the 19-year-old local lad scored a well-taken winner. For a manager who has been called all the names under the sun and had his decisions questioned since he arrived, Bruce got it spot on here.

Steve Bruce got his first win against Manchester United in 23 attempts on Sunday afternoon

19-year-old Matty Longstaff repaid Bruce's faith by putting in a man of the match performance

He answered his critics the best way possible, by doing his talking on the pitch. It was his 23rd attempt at beating Manchester United as a manager and his first win.

What a time to get it, too. A perfect response to what happened at the King Power Stadium. People will talk about the failings of Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s United, but we have to applaud the men in black and white.

The fans were superb, too. I’ve said all along it is extremely harsh to judge Bruce so early into his time at Newcastle. He needs time.

This win could see act as a foundation to build on. Newcastle’s boss and their players will enjoy their international break a lot more now. They will be raring to go against Chelsea once the Premier League returns.
description: CHRIS SUTTON: After their horrific 5-0 loss to Leicester last week, Steve Bruce opted for a back three, and it delivered him a clean sheet, and he showed faith in Matty Longstaff who repaid it.
authors: Chris Sutton For The Daily Mail
